examples: he never did anything to thwart his father
he was thwarted in his desire to punish Uncle Fred

noun.description: A structural crosspiece sometimes forming a seat for a rower in a boat.

preposition &amp; adverb.description: From one side to another side of; across.
examples: a pink-tinged cloud spread thwart the shore

origin: Middle English thwerte, from the adjective thwert perverse, obstinate, adverse, from Old Norse thvert, neuter of thverr transverse, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin torquere to twist.
